intro: Achyranthes aspera var. velutina, commonly known as velvet senna, is a shrub native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its hairy, velvety leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed areas. Its botanical features make it a common weed in agricultural fields and along roadsides.
